metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3253 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: The MethodClosure class in runtime/MethodClosure.java in Apache Groovy 1.7.0 through 2.4.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service via a crafted serialized object.

notes.Note: ebarretto> groovy in Xenial is currently FTBFS. Also there's no more support from upstream to that version (1.8.6)

criterions.comment: groovy: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
